title: Using EDAB Utilities Functions for NE ESPs
text: vignette demonstrates use functions within EDABUtilities package (https://github.com/NEFSC/READ_EDAB_Utilities/tree/main) examining ecosystem data ESPs. example functions apply input data (.nc files) shape files utilized golden tilefish ESP.

what: Crop netCDFs of bottom temperature and bottom salinity to shape file of BTS strata
title: Using EDAB Utilities Functions for NE ESPs
text: Crops 2D netCDF based extent shape file.
code: crop_bottomT <- EDABUtilities::crop_nc_2d(data.in = c(here::here('data','glorys_bottomT.nc')),                             output.files = c(here::here('data','crop_glorys_bottomT.nc')),                             shp.file = here::here('shapefiles','BTS_STRATA.shp'),                             #area.names = c('01030'),                             var.name = 'bottomT',                             write.out = F)  terra::plot(crop_bottomT[[1]]) crop_bottomS <- EDABUtilities::crop_nc_2d(data.in = c(here::here('data','glorys_bottomS.nc')),                             output.files = c(here::here('data','crop_glorys_bottomS.nc')),                             shp.file = here::here('shapefiles','BTS_STRATA.shp'),                             var.name = 'bottomS',                             write.out = F)  terra::plot(crop_bottomS[[1]])

what: Make 2d summary time series: mean monthly bottom temperature in golden tilefish BTS strata
title: Using EDAB Utilities Functions for NE ESPs
text: Provides summary statistics 2d gridded data time series area.
code: monthly_bt <- EDABUtilities::make_2d_summary_ts(data.in = c(here::here('data','glorys_bottomT.nc')),                             output.files = c(here::here('data','GLORYS_monthly_bottomT.nc')),                             shp.file = here::here('shapefiles','BTS_STRATA.shp'),                             var.name = 'bottomT',                             area.names = c('01030', '01040', '01070', '01080', '01110', '01120',                                             '01140', '01150', '01670', '01680', '01710', '01720',                                             '01750', '01760'),                             statistic = 'mean',                             agg.time = 'days',                             tz = NA,                             touches = TRUE,                             write.out = F)  ggplot2::ggplot(monthly_bt[[1]],ggplot2::aes(x = time, y= value))+   ggplot2::geom_line(lwd = 1)+    ggplot2::labs(title = 'Monthly Bottom Temperature in GTF Strata') +   ggplot2::xlab('Month') +   ggplot2::ylab('Bottom Temperature') +   ggplot2::theme_bw() +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~area)

what: Make 2d summary time series: mean daily bottom salinity in golden tilefish BTS strata
title: Using EDAB Utilities Functions for NE ESPs
text: Provides summary statistics 2d gridded data time series area.
code: daily_bS <- EDABUtilities::make_2d_summary_ts(data.in = c(here::here('data','glorys_bottomS.nc')),                    output.files = c(here::here('data','GLORYS_daily_bottomS.nc')),                    shp.file = here::here('shapefiles','BTS_STRATA.shp'),                    var.name = 'bottomS',                    area.names = c('01030', '01040', '01070', '01080', '01110', '01120',                                             '01140', '01150', '01670', '01680', '01710', '01720',                                             '01750', '01760'),                    statistic = 'mean',                    agg.time = 'days',                    tz = NA,                    touches = TRUE,                    write.out = F)  ggplot2::ggplot(daily_bS[[1]],ggplot2::aes(x = time, y= value))+   ggplot2::geom_line(lwd = 1)+    ggplot2::labs(title = 'Daily Bottom Salinity in GTF Strata') +   ggplot2::xlab('Days') +   ggplot2::ylab('Bottom Salinity') +   ggplot2::theme_bw() +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~area)

what: Make 2d gridded time series: calculate number of days (nd) above a bottom temperature threshold (14C) in the golden tilefish BTS strata
title: Using EDAB Utilities Functions for NE ESPs
text: Provides data frame degree-day family statistics
code: dd <- EDABUtilities::make_2d_deg_day_ts(data.in = c(here::here('data','glorys_bottomT.nc')),                               output.files = c(here::here('data','GLORYS_monthly_bottomT.nc')),                               shp.file = here::here('shapefiles','BTS_STRATA.shp'),                               var.name = 'bottomT',                               area.names = c('01030', '01040', '01070', '01080', '01110', '01120',                                              '01140', '01150', '01670', '01680', '01710', '01720',                                              '01750', '01760'),                    ref.value = 14,                    type = 'above',                    statistic = 'nd',                    write.out = F)  dd_df = dplyr::bind_rows(dd)  ggplot2::ggplot(dd_df,ggplot2::aes(x = ls.id, y = value, fill = area))+   ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = 'identity', position = ggplot2::position_dodge(width = 1.0))+   ggplot2::labs(title = 'Number of days above 14C', fill = "Strata Number") +   ggplot2::xlab('GTF Strata') +   ggplot2::ylab('Days') +   ggplot2::theme_bw()

title: Generate Preliminary ESP Reports for the Northeast

title: Generate Preliminary ESP Reports for the Northeast
text: Ecosystem Socioeconomic Profiles (ESPs) scientific product support Integrated Ecosystem Assessment (IEA). IEA seeks improve understanding management fisheries incorporating natural, social, economic data fisheries analyses management plans. ESPs structured framework developed Alaska Science Center integrate ecosystem socioeconomic information stock assessment process.1 adapt ESP process use management Northeast stocks. scientific roadmap consists steps: Gather existing data ecology, biology, socioeconomics, human dimension Northeast fisheries. Conduct risk analysis Northeast stocks determine stocks vulnerable. Create detailed reports vulnerable stocks, incorporating data original risk assessment well detailed species-specific information.

title: Generate Preliminary ESP Reports for the Northeast
text: current preliminary report pulls data many existing sources creates several data visualizations. Reports northeast stocks compiled can viewed . Data, functions, report templates aggregated R package, NEesp. See brief demo use package. reports work progress viewed final complete product time. guarantee reports free errors; please contact us notice issues.

title: Generate Preliminary ESP Reports for the Northeast
text: currently 4 github repos associated Northeast ESP initiative. NOAA-EDAB/esp_data_aggregation original repo currently houses development exploratory work. NEFSC/READ-EDAB-NEesp houses R package contains relevant data, functions low-level data analysis plotting, report templates. NEFSC/READ-EDAB-NEespShiny houses R Shiny app (form R package) provides graphical user interface creating reports NEesp package. NEFSC/READ-EDAB-ESP_docs houses static reports Northeast stocks ecosystem/socioeconomic indicators.

title: Generate Preliminary ESP Reports for the Northeast
text: continue synthesize existing data Northeast stocks, environment, socioeconomics. currently refining data analyses beginning preliminary risk assessment process.

title: Create Cold Pool Extent — create_coldpool_extent
text: function generates cold pool extent indicator ecodata R package R object Cold pool extent:  total area bottom temperatures remain 10 °C least 2 months June September Positive values == Larger Negative values == Smaller

title: Create Cold Pool Extent — create_coldpool_extent
text: data Filepath indicator data return Boolean. Whether return indicator object global environment

title: Create Cold Pool Extent — create_coldpool_extent
text: Saves R object coldpool_extent, returns cold pool extent indicator

title: Create Cold Pool Index — create_coldpool_index
text: function generates cold pool index indicator ecodata R package R object Cold pool index: quantifies interannual strength cold pool Positive values == colder Negative values == warmer

title: Create Cold Pool Index — create_coldpool_index
text: data Filepath indicator data return Boolean. Whether return indicator object global environment

title: Create Cold Pool Index — create_coldpool_index
text: Saves R object coldpool_index, returns cold pool index indicator

title: Create Cold Pool Persistence — create_coldpool_persistence
text: function generates cold pool persistence indicator ecodata R package R object Cold pool persistence: duration cold pool, ends bottom temperature rises 10 °C formed year Positive values == Longer Negative values == Shorter

text: data Filepath indicator data return Boolean. Whether return indicator object global environment

title: Create Cold Pool Persistence — create_coldpool_persistence

title: Convert netcdf to raster — nc_to_raster
text: function converts netcdf object raster object

title: Convert netcdf to raster — nc_to_raster
code: nc_to_raster(   nc,   varname,   extent = c(0, 360, -90, 90),   crop = raster::extent(280, 300, 30, 50),   show_images = FALSE )

title: Convert netcdf to raster — nc_to_raster
text: nc nc file path varname name variable convert raster extent latitude longitude range data , form c(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax). Defaults c(0, 360, -90, 90) crop extent object use crop data. Defaults raster::extent(280, 300, 30, 50) (Northeast US) show_images Boolean. Whether display images data. Useful check cropping occurring correctly.

title: Convert netcdf to raster — nc_to_raster
text: raster brick
